metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016 from jingyangling station, upstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located in jingyangling pass, qilian county, qinghai province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 101.1160e, 37.8384N and 3750m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 5m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm underground, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe is buried at 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (in Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: percentage).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Some invalid values of 4cm soil moisture appeared in November and December.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2016-9-1010:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游景阳岭站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县景阳岭垭口，下垫面是高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是101.1160E, 37.8384N，海拔3750m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；4cm土壤水分在11-12月份出现一些无效数值；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（ET）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间的关系更为复杂。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而变得主导。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型也能可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
research objective: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China.
This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.
challenges: However, several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. However, the above modeling efforts suffered from 1) the availability of the forcing data (only two weather stations operated by the Chinese Meteorological Administration functioned in the upper reaches of the HRB) and 2) a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for parameterization.
Unfortunately, this did not work well due to the influence of strong wind. Therefore, snow density data, which can be calculated using snow depth and SWE data, are not available at present.
methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.
dataset: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China. Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The updated datasets were released to scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds (i.e., cryosphere science, hydrology, and meteorology), and they are expected to serve as a testing platform to provide accurate forcing data and validate and evaluate remote sensing products and hydrological models for a broader community.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. The observed snow variables included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) and blowing (drifting) snow. Data obtained from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 are summarized in Figure 4, with additional plots for precipitation, ET, soil temperature and moisture. The datasets are available from 2012/12/05 to 2017/12/31, with intermittent loss mostly due to power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文学研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文学研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都有可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。飘雪在该地区也很常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂雪）现象。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有益的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游地区运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在集中的观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和风吹（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在阿柔冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell公司）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，来自美国Campbell公司）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（来自瑞士IAV公司）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，采用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还从冻土观测超级站获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程。这些更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为一个测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟，以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（飘雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，期间由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障，数据 intermittently 丢失。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for meteorological parameters in the alpine hydrology observation network compare to those used in the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯水文观测网络中气象参数的数据收集方法与黑河水联合遥测实验研究中使用的方法有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The alpine hydrology observation network uses automatic meteorological stations to monitor meteorological and hydrological parameters continuously, while the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research utilizes a flux observation matrix consisting of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. Both aim to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes but differ in their configurations and specific instrumentation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯水文观测网络使用自动气象站持续监测气象和水文参数，而黑河水联合遥测实验研究则利用由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵。两者都旨在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，但在配置和具体仪器上有所不同。

Comparison.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集受到寒冷、恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形的影响，导致数据不完整。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠地区主要面临多尺度观测的可用性和捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用的复杂性等挑战，但不一定面临相同的恶劣环境条件。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the combination of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures with stable isotope techniques improve the estimation of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何将地面测量的土壤和冠层组成温度与稳定同位素技术相结合，以改善对异质景观中蒸散的估算？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures allows for better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates when combined with stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope measurements. This approach provides more accurate inputs for the two-source energy balance model and overcomes limitations related to the uncertainty of surface-air temperature differences, which are crucial for estimating evapotranspiration in mixed soil-vegetation environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，可以更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发估算，当与稳定的氧和氢同位素测量结合时。这种方法为双源能量平衡模型提供了更准确的输入，并克服了与表面空气温度差异相关的不确定性，这对于在混合土壤-植被环境中估算蒸散发至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges do researchers face in accurately modeling hydrological processes in alpine regions, and how do observation networks address these challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 研究人员在准确建模高山地区的水文过程时面临哪些挑战，以及观测网络如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in alpine regions include harsh climate conditions, high altitude, complex topography, and technological barriers, which limit data availability and accuracy for modeling. Integrated and distributed observation networks, such as the one established in the Heihe River Basin, provide comprehensive datasets of hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data, enabling better parameterization and validation of hydrological models and remote sensing products.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区面临的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔、复杂的地形和技术障碍，这些因素限制了数据的可用性和建模的准确性。像在黑河流域建立的综合和分布式观测网络提供了全面的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据集，使得水文模型和遥感产品的参数化和验证得以更好地进行。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways do multiscale observation experiments contribute to understanding eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous landscapes, and what are the limitations of such approaches?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测实验如何有助于理解异质景观中的生态水文过程，以及此类方法的局限性是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation experiments, such as those conducted during HiWATER, capture data across hierarchically nested scales and diverse landscapes, providing a rich dataset for understanding interactions between oasis and desert systems. However, these experiments are limited by the availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of integrating data across different scales and disciplines.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测实验，如在HiWATER期间进行的实验，捕获了跨层次嵌套尺度和多样化景观的数据，为理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用提供了丰富的数据集。然而，这些实验受到多尺度观测可用性和跨不同尺度和学科整合数据复杂性的限制。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges causing difficulties in collecting consistent and comprehensive data in alpine regions, particularly for hydrological modelling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，收集一致和全面的数据以进行水文建模的主要挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed. These factors hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. The scarcity of observation data, due to difficulties of access and technological barriers, has been a significant obstacle.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多个挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行完整和一致的数据收集。这些因素妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺已成为一个重大障碍。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors complicate the measurement and estimation of evapotranspiration (ET) using ground-based methods in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用地面方法测量和估算蒸散发（ET）的因素有哪些复杂性？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The complexity arises from the heterogeneous nature of the landscape where soil and vegetation have different temperatures and resistances to energy exchange. Errors in component temperature estimates due to image classification errors can also complicate measurements. Additionally, in strongly advective environments, the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences affects the performance of models like the TSEB model used for estimating ET.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 复杂性源于土壤和植被在温度和能量交换阻力方面的异质性。由于图像分类错误导致的组件温度估计误差也会使测量变得复杂。此外，在强对流环境中，地表与空气温度差的不确定性会影响像TSEB模型这样的蒸散发（ET）估计模型的性能。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments in the alpine region?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区需要下一代生态系统观测网络和实验？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The need arises from the scarcity of observational data, which is due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers in alpine regions. These challenges have hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research, motivating the development of advanced observation networks to provide accurate data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 这种需求源于观测数据的稀缺，这主要是由于高山地区的获取困难和技术障碍。这些挑战阻碍了高山水文模型及相关研究的发展，促使我们建立先进的观测网络，以提供准确的数据用于水文建模，验证遥感数据，并提高对高山水文过程的预测理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the integration of multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection affect the accuracy of hydrological models in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多尺度和多学科数据收集的整合如何影响异质景观中水文模型的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection enhances the accuracy of hydrological models in heterogeneous landscapes by providing comprehensive datasets that capture the complexity of diverse ecosystems and landscape interactions, leading to more informed model parameterization and validation.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多尺度和多学科的数据收集可以提高异质景观中水文模型的准确性，因为它提供了全面的数据集，捕捉了多样生态系统和景观相互作用的复杂性，从而导致更为合理的模型参数化和验证。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of establishing a multiscale observation network in alpine regions for hydrological research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区建立多尺度观测网络的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective of establishing a multiscale observation network in alpine regions is to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, evaluate distributed models, and improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区建立多尺度观测网络的主要目标是提供准确的强迫数据用于水文建模，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals drive the collection and analysis of soil and canopy component temperatures in evapotranspiration studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在蒸散发研究中，收集和分析土壤和冠层成分温度的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals driving the collection and analysis of soil and canopy component temperatures in evapotranspiration studies include improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, enhancing the accuracy of energy balance models, and enabling better validation of evaporation and transpiration measurements using stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在蒸散发研究中，收集和分析土壤及冠层组分温度的目标包括改善土壤和冠层净辐射的估算，提高能量平衡模型的准确性，以及通过稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统更好地验证蒸发和蒸腾测量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in setting up a multiscale hydrometeorological observation network in an alpine region?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区建立多尺度水文气象观测网络涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In the alpine region, establishing a multiscale hydrometeorological observation network involves installing automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations. This includes measuring meteorological variables such as wind, air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Snow cover properties are collected from a snow observation superstation, and high-resolution soil physics datasets are obtained to capture freeze-thaw processes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，建立多尺度水文气象观测网络涉及安装自动气象站（AMS）和用于雪盖和冻土观测的超级站。这包括测量气象变量，如风速、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雪盖特性数据来自雪观测超级站，而高分辨率土壤物理数据集则用于捕捉冻融过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can ground-based measurements be used to improve the estimation of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何利用地面测量来改善对异质景观中蒸散发的估计？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurements can be used to improve the estimation of evapotranspiration by deploying instruments such as eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras. These tools measure soil and canopy component temperatures and turbulent fluxes, which are then used as inputs to models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components. Validation is achieved through comparisons with stable isotopes and other measurement techniques.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 地面测量可以通过部署涡度协方差系统和热红外相机等仪器来改善蒸散发的估算。这些工具测量土壤和冠层组件的温度以及湍流通量，然后将这些数据作为输入用于像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，以将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾两个部分。通过与稳定同位素和其他测量技术的比较来进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enabled the collection of multiscale and multidisciplinary data in alpine hydrology research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中能够收集多尺度和多学科的数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments, advanced remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, and the establishment of hierarchically nested instrumentation scales enabled the collection of multiscale and multidisciplinary data in alpine hydrology research.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的使用、先进的遥感技术如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，以及建立分层嵌套的仪器尺度，使得在高山水文学研究中能够收集多尺度和多学科的数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does integrating remote sensing data with ground observations enhance the predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，如何增强对高山地区水文过程的预测理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground observations improves the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validating remote sensing data, and evaluating distributed models. This approach helps address uncertainties in remote sensing data, especially in complex alpine terrains, leading to a better understanding of eco-hydrological functions and their responses to environmental changes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，可以通过提供准确的水文模型强迫数据、验证遥感数据和评估分布式模型，来改善水文过程的预测。这种方法有助于解决遥感数据中的不确定性，特别是在复杂的高山地形中，从而更好地理解生态水文功能及其对环境变化的响应。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the quality control and validation of datasets obtained from hydrometeorological observation networks in alpine environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以实现来自高山环境水文气象观测网络的数据集的质量控制和验证？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Quality control and validation of datasets in alpine environments are enabled by careful sensor calibration, data processing, and the use of advanced measurement techniques such as eddy covariance systems, snow observation superstations, and wireless sensor networks. These methods ensure accurate data collection and validation against ground measurements, facilitating reliable hydrological modeling and remote sensing product assessments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在高山环境中，数据集的质量控制和验证得益于精确的传感器校准、数据处理以及使用先进的测量技术，如涡度协方差系统、雪观测超级站和无线传感器网络。这些方法确保了与地面测量的准确数据收集和验证，从而促进了可靠的水文建模和遥感产品评估。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods in alpine regions face significant challenges, and what are the expected outcomes of overcoming these challenges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，数据收集方法可能面临重大挑战，这些挑战的预期结果是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine regions is challenging due to the cold, harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which hinder complete and consistent data collection. Overcoming these challenges is expected to enhance the accuracy of hydrological models and facilitate the integration of remote sensing data, ultimately improving the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，数据收集面临挑战，原因包括寒冷、恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。克服这些挑战预计将提高水文模型的准确性，并促进遥感数据的整合，从而最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is there an expectation that multiscale observation datasets can improve the accuracy of hydrological models, and what might be the limitations of achieving these outcomes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么人们期望多尺度观测数据集能够提高水文模型的准确性，以及实现这些结果可能面临的限制是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation datasets are expected to improve the accuracy of hydrological models by providing comprehensive data across different scales and disciplines, which can inform model parameterization and validation. However, limitations may include the availability and consistency of high-quality data, especially in complex terrains with limited access, which can affect the datasets' ability to fully represent the dynamic natural processes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测数据集预计将通过提供跨不同尺度和学科的综合数据来提高水文模型的准确性，这可以为模型参数化和验证提供支持。然而，局限性可能包括高质量数据的可用性和一致性，特别是在复杂地形和有限访问的情况下，这可能会影响数据集充分代表动态自然过程的能力。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated benefits of integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing observations in eco-hydrological studies, and what challenges could influence these expected outcomes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，整合地面测量与遥感观测的预期好处是什么，以及哪些挑战可能影响这些预期结果？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing observations is anticipated to provide a more comprehensive and accurate evaluation of eco-hydrological processes by combining detailed local data with broader spatial observations. Challenges that could influence these outcomes include the uncertainties associated with remote sensing data, particularly in complex or heterogeneous landscapes, and the need for effective calibration and validation to ensure data reliability.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与遥感观测相结合，预计将通过结合详细的地方数据和更广泛的空间观测，提供对生态水文过程更全面和准确的评估。可能影响这些结果的挑战包括与遥感数据相关的不确定性，特别是在复杂或异质的景观中，以及需要有效的校准和验证以确保数据的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in collecting accurate soil and canopy component temperatures, and how might these affect the reliability of data for eco-hydrological modeling?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在收集准确的土壤和冠层组件温度时可能面临哪些挑战，这些挑战如何影响生态水文模型数据的可靠性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting accurate soil and canopy component temperatures include errors due to image classification, which vary with vegetation abundance, and uncertainties related to atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance. These factors can lead to overestimated canopy temperatures and impact the reliability of eco-hydrological models by increasing uncertainties in the energy balance and component temperature estimates.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 收集准确的土壤和冠层成分温度面临的挑战包括由于图像分类导致的误差，这些误差随着植被丰度的变化而变化，以及与大气上行辐射和透射率相关的不确定性。这些因素可能导致冠层温度的高估，并影响生态水文模型的可靠性，增加能量平衡和成分温度估计的不确定性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can multiscale observation networks contribute to overcoming the scarcity of data in alpine hydrological research, and what are the limitations of these networks?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测网络可以通过哪些方式帮助克服高山水文研究中的数据稀缺问题，这些网络的局限性是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation networks, such as those combining meteorological stations, remote sensing, and ground measurements, can fill data gaps by providing comprehensive datasets for alpine hydrological research. They facilitate the integration of various data sources to improve model validation and understanding of hydrological processes. However, challenges remain due to the harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which can hinder consistent data collection and the development of remote sensing technologies.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测网络，如结合气象站、遥感和地面测量的数据网络，可以通过提供全面的数据集来填补阿尔卑斯水文研究中的数据空白。它们促进了各种数据源的整合，以改善模型验证和对水文过程的理解。然而，由于恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，仍然存在挑战，这可能会妨碍一致的数据收集和遥感技术的发展。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how datasets can ensure accuracy and reliability given the harsh and variable conditions of alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定数据集如何能确保在高山地区恶劣和多变的条件下的准确性和可靠性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets from alpine regions are often ensured for accuracy and reliability by employing sophisticated observation networks and rigorous data quality control measures. These include using automated meteorological stations and superstations that collect continuous hydrometeorological data, and validating remote sensing data with ground-based observations, despite challenges posed by the harsh conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的数据集通常通过采用复杂的观测网络和严格的数据质量控制措施来确保准确性和可靠性。这些措施包括使用自动气象站和超级气象站收集连续的水文气象数据，以及用地面观测验证遥感数据，尽管恶劣的环境条件带来了挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the various data collection methods used in capturing soil moisture and temperature in alpine regions and evaluate their effectiveness in harsh climates.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在高山地区捕捉土壤湿度和温度的各种数据收集方法，并评估它们在恶劣气候条件下的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the alpine region, soil moisture and temperature are monitored using automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and wireless sensor networks (WSNs). These methods capture data at multiple layers and are designed to withstand harsh climates, although challenges such as strong winds and technological barriers can affect data completeness and consistency.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，土壤湿度和温度通过自动气象站（AMSs）和无线传感器网络（WSNs）进行监测。这些方法在多个层面上捕获数据，并设计成能够承受恶劣气候，尽管强风和技术障碍等挑战可能会影响数据的完整性和一致性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the methodologies applied to separate and validate evapotranspiration components in heterogeneous landscapes and discuss their implications for water resource management.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在异质景观中分离和验证蒸散发组成部分所应用的方法论，并讨论其对水资源管理的影响。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model is used to separate evapotranspiration components by utilizing soil and canopy component temperatures. Validation is performed using stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems. This approach helps accurately estimate evapotranspiration, which is crucial for efficient water resource management in heterogeneous landscapes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型用于通过利用土壤和冠层组件温度来分离蒸散发成分。验证是通过稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统进行的。这种方法有助于准确估计蒸散发，这对于异质景观中的水资源管理至关重要。
